CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 23, 1941, pg. 21, reads: "Shop to Have Formal Opening - Bates New Sandwich Shop, located at 2300 Centre avenue, will have its formal opening after extensive construction work has been completed on Friday, August 22nd, with free souvenirs to be given away by the Rieck-McJunkin Dairy Company.  C. Bates, well known figure in the Hill District, promises a varied and tasty menu at all times including foot-long hot dogs, jumbo hamburgers, various other sandwiches, coffee, soda, sundaes, and banana splits.  Bates has already opened his shop to the public and is doing 'business as usual' but the establishment will not have its formal opening until August 22nd."
TitMainTitle: Bate's Sandwich Shop with neon sign in window reading "Bate's foot long hot dogs $ .10," 2300 Centre Avenue, Hill District
